Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
clique
<mathematics> A {maximal} {totally connected} {subgraph}. Given a {graph} with {nodes} N, a clique C is a {subset} of N where every node in C is directly connected to every other node in C (i.e. C is totally connected), and C contains all such nodes (C is maximal). In other words, a clique contains all, and only, those nodes which are directly connected to all other nodes in the clique.
[Is this correct?]
(1996-09-22)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Clique \Clique\ (kl[=e]k), n. [F., fr. OF. cliquer to click. See {Click}, v. i.] A narrow circle of persons associated by common interests or for the accomplishment of a common purpose; -- generally used in a bad sense. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Clique \Clique\, v. i. To To associate together in a clannish way; to act with others secretly to gain a desired end; to plot; -- used with together. [1913 Webster]
clique n : an exclusive circle of people with a common purpose [syn: {coterie}, {ingroup}, {inner circle}, {pack}, {camp}]
